kate@naturebox.com Experience Corporate Sales Representative NatureBox June 2015  – Present (3 months) Stewardship Manager Stanford University December 2013  –  June 2015  (1 year 7 months) Stanford Institute for Economic Policy Research As part of a lean two-person development team, I wear many hats. Key responsibilities: 
 
Oversee stewardship and communications efforts based on Stanford University standards 
Manage annual giving program; support major gift solicitations and special fund campaigns 
Track and report donor levels, gift income, other relevant metrics 
Create internal and external marketing collateral and web content  
Streamline systems to improve donor experience for on-boarding and renewal processes 
Implemented best practices-driven annual donor satisfaction survey  
Part of team tasked with developing proprietary database as end-user Corporate Development Manager Asia Society Northern California September 2011  –  December 2013  (2 years 4 months) San Francisco Reporting to Global Director of Development, responsible for growth of corporate funding stream for ASNC, including program underwriting, membership and sponsorships. Manage key corporate accounts and oversee sponsorship and membership fulfillment for corporate supporters. Support creation and implementation of global and regional strategy. Drive and communicate value for corporate funders; identify and activate opportunities for strategic corporate engagement. Manage execution of ASNC's largest fundraising event (40%+ of annual revenue).  
 
Key results (FY13): 
o Exceeded overall revenue target by 13% (45% jump to $1.13M)  
o 24% YoY growth in Annual Dinner revenue (over 40% of ASNC budget)  
o 14% YoY growth in Global Corporate Memberships  
o 86% YoY growth in program underwriting Senior Liaison, Committees Dept. American Chamber of Commerce in Shanghai, China September 2008  –  August 2011  (3 years) Support needs of American business community through information-sharing, education and government engagement at the largest Chamber in Asia-Pacific. Manage portfolio of eight Committees: administrative support, program planning, issue mapping and government advocacy efforts. Supported event planning for high-level U.S. Government visitors. Responsible for hiring and management of interns.
